page.title: 01REVIEW OF EAST MONKLANDS 1
page.content: THE EAST MONKLANDS LIE TO THE EAST AND NORTH EAST OF THE TOWN OF AIRDRIE AND COVER A LARGE SECTION OF{RURAL} NORTH LANARKSHIRE. IT IS AN AREA WITH A PROUD INDUSTRIAL HERITAGE IN {COALMINING}PARTICULARLY DURING THE 19TH AND EARLY 20TH CENTURIES. THE AREA'S WEALTH LAY IN ITS ABUNDANT SUPPLIES OF A VARIETY OF COALS AND BLACKBAND IRONSTONE. THE INCREASING DEMAND FOR COAL TO SUPPLY THE IRON AND STEEL INDUSTRY AROUND COATBRIDGE (IRON BURGH) TO THE WEST OF AIRDRIE, SAW THE NUMBER OF COAL MINES REACH A PEAK OF ABOUT 100 IN THE 1830'S. RAILWAYS WERE CONSTRUCTED (NOW ALL DISMANTLED) E.G. THE BALLOCHNEY RAILWAY TO TAKE THE COAL TO THE IRONWORKS AND TO THE MONKLAND CANAL FOR TRANSPORT TO THE GLASGOW MARKET.
